subject: Politics
title: Why Geography Matters
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why Geography Matters.

hook.text: America has two oceans as moats. Russia has flat plains that invite invasion. Geography is destiny.

buildup.text: Mountains provide defense. Rivers enable trade. Coastlines give access to the global economy.

discovery.text: Britain became a naval power because it's an island. Landlocked Bolivia remains poor partly because of geography.

twist.text: Geography isn't fate. Singapore is a tiny island with no resources â€” yet it became one of the richest nations.

climax.text: Smart policy can overcome bad geography. But ignoring geography leads to strategic blunders again and again.

punchline.text: Geography sets the board. Strategy decides the game.

quiz.question: Why did Britain become a major naval power?
options: Its island geography made naval strength essential
It had the world's largest population
It had the most natural resources
